main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted visually by a civilian observer near Lynchburg, Virginia on June 19, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as bright, fast-traveling, and showed no exhaust or other identifying characteristics.
The observer was reported to have had anti-aircraft experience and was at the Virginia Episcopal School when the sighting occurred.
An attempt was made to intercept the object using a fighter aircraft from Langley Air Force Base, but the results were negative.
Piedmont Airlines Flight 230 (a DC-3) was in the area at the time of the sighting, but did not report seeing anything unusual.
The weather conditions at the time and place of the sighting were clear, with 5-10 mile visibility and no extraordinary wind or other weather conditions.
sighted object: A bright, fast-moving object with no exhaust or other identifying characteristics
witnesses: A civilian observer reported to have had anti-aircraft experience
photographs: No, the report does not contain any photographs
